ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about the systems, policies, and programs that affect Latin Immigration to the United States. This course gives a great overview on the terms involving Latino/a/e and Hispanic and provides a great base for understanding the different factors that cause and affect Latin migration.

I learned about theories behind migration and both historical and contemporary understandings of migration. I also learned more about how to write a sociology-oriented paper as opposed to the ER&M papers I am more used to, which was helpful.
A comprehensive understanding of Latin American immigration from a micro and macro perspective.

I learned so much more about the immigration system and stories throughout this course. It was something that I always looked into, but not in much depth. Very grateful to be a part of this course and learn about a new field. I was able to gain interviewing skills from this course and it was part of my final paper for this class as well.

I learned a ton about migration from different countries outside Latin America, the impact of migration policies, the realities once migrants get to the U.S. and also about different factors that influence a person's migration to the U.S.
An introduction to the history of Latin American immigration to the US, and the forces that caused it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: The lectures were very helpful in summarizing the readings and provoking thoughtful discussion, the readings were extremely diverse and provided a wide range of interesting topics and policies, while we only had a few activities, they were all extremely helpful in understanding difficult topics

strengths: Prof. Escamilla Garcia is an extremely passionate, knowledgeable, and approachable professor -- he made the course one in which students were extremely comfortable and eager to learn more about; the readings were usually pretty manageable lengths; the midterm and final were also very fair and manageable; Prof. Escamilla Garcia also makes it very fun to be in his class and was very flexible with deadlines, etc. 

weaknesses: none that I can think of! maybe that we didn't always discuss the readings as in-depth as possible, but i still felt i got a lot out of what was talked about instead so honestly no complains

Strengths were the readings and the expertise of the professor
Weakness were the lack of rigorous discussion in class

The professor is passionate with this subject, so it makes it makes the class more engaging and fun. He is also incredibly understanding and gives many opportunities to get feedback on the work we produce it class. A professor I will remember forever, he looks out for your best self-interest, but pushes your learning more.

Strengths: Incredible professor, really engaging material and good readings
Weaknesses: It wasn't always clear what the expectations on bigger assignments were until they were graded

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would definitely recommend this course to another student! Professor Escamilla is an amazing professor, and he makes such thought-provoking questions. His lectures, readings, and background knowledge are helpful and insightful in guiding class discussions and helping us understand difficult topics. This was an amazing course, and I would love to take any course with Professor Escamilla!
Absolutely! If the student is interested in migration studies, Prof. Escamilla Garcia provides a great introduction to the topic and a productive, welcoming environment for students to learn in.
Yes, I would! It provides you with a great understanding of how complex the migration crisis is.

I would recommend this course, he really gives you so much material as well as brings some of his research into the class. This course allowed for a place to venture on your own and conduct interviews related to the material we learned in class. It taught some important skills and expanded my knowledge within the subject of the class.
Absolutely. It's an amazing course. Everyone should take it.
Yes. It's a great course and you learn so much! Professor Escamilla Garcia is also a very engaging lecturer!
